column4: Hello guys when I built this PC I installed 9.04 and everything works great, I couldnt be happier except a mouse lockup issue.I just went and bought a copy of Doom3 to play on my Ubuntu setup and it runs fantastic.However there is an occasional mouse lockup at seemingly random times.Yesterday it never locked up once and i played for hours.Today I booted and not even 3 mins go by and the mouse locked up.When i use the keyboard strokes to

Also ever since I installed 9.04 it has an error on bootup about a referenced package not found or something.It goes away realy fast but ui think it has to do with ACPI.By mobo wont let me disable that so Im not sure exactly what the message is or how to fix it.Can anyone take the time to help diagbose this?
ok
http://pastebin.com/m78c890e5
Ctl ALT Del and lrestart is what i have been doing
Does that pastebin of my dmesg help any? Im not sure what to look for there.
What should my BIOS be set to as far as PNP OS? That just get enabled for Windows only?Or do I enable that for Ubuntu as well? (I dont use Windows.)
are you familiar with boot options ?
yeah
as a possible suggestion, you could try booting with pci=noacpi
you could reference here for common boot options: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BootOptions#Common%20Boot%20Options

if you scroll up that page, it will tell you how to add temporary/permanent boot options. Just remember 'pci=noacpi', reboot, try it, see if it works. If it does then make it permanent. If it doesn't, you can come back here and someone may look into it further.
gnome log viewer will show all messages
Great is that a command on the CLI or is it in the menus somewhere?
System->Administration->Log File Viewer
alternately, less /var/log/messages
and dmesg will show alot of useful kernel messages too.
Is there a place that i can see all the boot options like you mentioned so i can see them all and know my options? such as the pci=noacpi sp?
I suppose O'Reilly's Linux Kernel in a nutshell has a good list: http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/people/gregkh/lkn/lkn_pdf/ch09.pdf
Thank you
the Ubuntu Help documentation should be sufficient enough though. You don't really need to ever stray beyond the most common options.
What log should i be checking to see that error message that appears before the desktop comes up? I cant find it so far.
Ok thank you very much for helping me.Have a good one!
ACPI is quite common actually on certain machines. I can't seem to see any specific fix on your [Reference] issue though.
